txt.en: 'Ah, excellent. This should give us adequate protection from whatever criminal elements may be left lurking in the city.\n\n'I can tell you're worried, but fret not. The gangs that remain have no interest in antagonizing the city's Gondorian host, and know that we intend to depart soon.'

As you hand over the orders, the guard opens the note and begins to read.\n\n'Thank goodness. I'll be happy to leave this area. If you listen you can hear those crooks and thieves from the across the bridge, plotting and yelling. They're looking forward to taking over more of the city.'

'Thanks for rescuing me, [placeholder].

'Faltharan told me about his plans to evacuate the city. There are still lots of pockets of criminal activity, so we'll need to make sure the guards are ready.

'I need you to deliver these orders to any guards stationed nearby. We will need them on alert for when we are ready to depart.'

As you hand over the orders, the guard opens the note and begins to read.\n\n'This has me a little worried. Why would they pull people away from one of the only places where there is still a threat to watch over? Oh well, I suppose that our leaders know best.'
As you hand over the orders, the guard opens the note and begins to read.\n\n'All right, I understand.'
In his preparation to help evacuate the city, Lorvegil has asked you to deliver new orders to the nearby troops stationed in Pelargir.

As you hand over the orders, the guard opens the note and begins to read.\n\n'Looks like we will have to get these ships ready for a lot of folk. The harbour-master isn't going to be too pleased about this!'
The guards can be found in the areas surrounding the market and shipyard.\n\nYou should deliver new orders to the guards.
As you hand over the orders, the guard opens the note and begins to read.\n\n'Finally, I get something to do! There's nothing here but ruined streets. Why do they have us guarding it, anyway?'
Lorvegil is located in the market east of Tol Ciryarani.\n\nYou should speak with Lorvegil.
As you hand over the orders, the guard opens the note and begins to read.\n\n'Well, all right then. It sounds like those men at the docks could use a hand or two, anyway.'

As you hand over the orders, the guard opens the note and begins to read.\n\n'What's this business? They don't think we can handle things around here, and now they're sending more guards to the docks?'

As you hand over the orders, the guard opens the note and begins to read.\n\n'Uh, won't this leave certain areas of the city a little vulnerable? I know the Corsairs are gone, but there's still plenty of threats from within the city.'
